channel.description: Sergey Kotlov's blog where I write about my experience working at the international network of businesses called Happy Melly, helping people be happy at work and visiting inspiring organisations around the world which care about happiness of their employees.

item.title: FutuFriday
item.description: Futurice and me have the longest “relationships” among the organisations in my tour. It sparkled my interest in more detailed investigation of fantastic companies. Futurice also became the first organisation which I studied carefully and wrote a case study. As you see it was no surprise at all I was excited when Yrjö invited me to take part in FutuFriday.

item.title: Reaktor
item.description: Reaktor got into my sight when I was preparing for two weeks in Helsinki. I went through my notes and found the only brief article about the company. It described that Reaktor won Best Place to Work in Europe award two times. Nevertheless, I got hooked. My interest grew considerably after I had visited their website and watched the video below. Reaktor’s own band recorded it and they use it “to make recruiting the summer help a whole lot more fun”.

item.title: Flowa
item.description: I met Antti and Juha last summer on my way to ALE. We should meet in Vantaa airport right before our flight. I had already spent several hours in the airport to that moment and fell asleep on a bench near the gate. Luckily I woke just in time to run into the airplane but I missed the meeting. It was the first (and I hope the last) time I missed the opportunity to drink beer with guys from Flowa.

item.title: Small things
item.description: The beginning of the week was frantic. I was running like a squirrel in a wheel trying to complete a mountain of tiny mechanical tasks related to my departure. Anxiety didn’t leave me. I was fearing the tour would be a disaster. Even the meeting with friends didn’t help a lot. Yesterday I went to visit my family who just came back from Croatia where they had stayed for a week. They handed me a book and the moment I took it my mood changed considerably…

item.title: One fine walk
item.description: Have you watched One fine day? It’s a kind funny story about two single parents who were late to bring their children to a boat trip and had to spend a whole crazy business day together. Of course falling in love at the end. I like this simple movie because it conveys very important thought: We should stop constantly trying to fix things. We should let them be as they are and enjoy the moment.

item.title: Test run
item.description: We use test runs in all spheres of our life. Extreme sport athletes ride a track several times before an event to know it better. Social networks first open new features to a small set of users to check their reaction. Companies have trial periods to prove a new hire is a good fit for the rest of a team.

item.title: Hard and funny
item.description: No matter how many dreams there are it’s easy to have them. Living even a tiny one is hard. Looking back over my shoulder I see how often I preferred an easy choice over a hard one. It didn’t make me happy. It didn’t make my life more fun, interesting and intriguing. Only simpler. About a week ago I gladly realized this time was over and I need to thank Happy Melly for that.

item.title: What is the colour of your life?
item.description: I experimented with multiple approaches to analyse my work. Only one of them stuck to me and have been helping me every day since then. Its major advantage is simplicity: I need to spend only 15 seconds per day.

item.title: Kudos On The Run
item.description: After two weeks of rush development we are glad to present a mobile-friendly version of Kudobox. It is easy to use, looks nice and, most important, gives you power to appreciate anyone from anywhere!

item.title: Appreciation Day
item.description: Last Thursday I was approached by two guys at local startup gathering to discuss what a value of Kudobox as a practice and a value of online Kudobox particularly is. There were a lot to say but one of the best stories I could tell them appeared the next day. And it was ACA IT-Solutions which related it…
